channel.title: Update server
channel.description: how do i get past the update server in deob 440?

item.title: Update server
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:2, topic:31317”]If you have any problem, at all, with connecting, just decompile the client.class, look for where it declares another client (IE search for "client ") and find the method it invokes. For example:

client client1 = new client(); client1.a(441, InetAddress.getLocalHost(), 41, 503, 14, nd.h + 32, "runescape", 765);
In the version I have, and make a new class:

import java.net.InetAddress;
public class GR{
	public static client client1 = new client();
	public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception{
		client1.a(441, InetAddress.getByName("ul7.runescape.com"), 41, 503, 14, nd.h + 32, "runescape", 765);
	}

Compile & run and your good.[/quote]

i told you how to make an external client. also why are you making an external class like that?

Read full topic

item.title: Update server
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

If you have any problem, at all, with connecting, just decompile the client.class, look for where it declares another client (IE search for "client ") and find the method it invokes. For example:

client client1 = new client(); client1.a(441, InetAddress.getLocalHost(), 41, 503, 14, nd.h + 32, "runescape", 765);
In the version I have, and make a new class:

import java.net.InetAddress;
public class GR{
	public static client client1 = new client();
	public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception{
		client1.a(441, InetAddress.getByName("ul7.runescape.com"), 41, 503, 14, nd.h + 32, "runescape", 765);
	}

Compile & run and your good.

Read full topic
